457.question: What do they mean by answer styles?
457.response: {'Answer': 'The term "answer styles" refers to the different ways in which answers can be generated in natural language processing experiments, as seen in the breakdown of lengths of answers in Caption 1.'}

458.question: Is there exactly one "answer style" per dataset?
458.response: {'Answer': 'No, there is not exactly one "answer style" per dataset.'}

459.question: What are the baselines that Masque is compared against?
459.response: {'Answer': 'Seo et al. (2017), Tay et al. (2018), Bauer et al. (2018), Indurthi et al. (2018), Hu et al. (2018), Yan et al. (2019), Shao (unpublished variant of Tan et al. (2018)), Li (unpublished model using Devlin et al. (2018) and See et al. (2017)), Qian (unpublished), Wu et al. (2018)'}
459.answer: BiDAF, Deep Cascade QA, S-Net+CES2S, BERT+Multi-PGNet, Selector+CCG, VNET, DECAPROP, MHPGM+NOIC, ConZNet, RMR+A2D

461.question: What is an "answer style"?
461.response: {'Answer': 'An "answer style" refers to the format or method used by a model to generate answers to questions, such as Natural Language Generation (NLG) or Question & Answer (Q&A).'}
